comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: William Trent Rossell (1849-1919), Engineer Commissioner of the District of Columbia, chief of engineers of the Army. Born in Alabama, West Point graduate (1873). He retired October 1913, which might have been the occasion for this portrait. His wife was daughter of Governor John Ellis of North Carolina. They had five sons serve in WWI; the youngest died at Verdun. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Trent_Rossell
